intro: Rondeletia disperma, commonly known as the golden rain tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, orange-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and usually elliptical in shape. The flowers are followed by small, round fruits that contain several seeds.
